Reason: The _journalDiskSync configuration option is performance-sensitive. This is because it directly affects the performance and reliability of the journaling process by determining whether disk synchronization is enabled. Disk synchronization can introduce overhead and impact system performance, especially if the journal() method is called frequently. The code snippet shows that the value of _journalDiskSync is directly used in creating a PersistentJournal object, indicating that it has a significant impact on the system level performance.
